channel.title: Dan Friedman's Data Science Tutorials - Python

item.title: Intro to Multithreading and Multiprocessing
item.description: Use multithreading and multiprocessing as options for parallel programming in Python to perform tasks at the same time
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Read in CSV Files for Data Analysis
item.description: Import CSV files into your Python program to analyze the data
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: List Comprehensions
item.description: Python's list comprehensions allow you to create lists with more concise code and often shorter execution times than a traditional multi-line program
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: String Formatting
item.description: Pass in data into a string to output data in a string in more detailed format
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Tuple Basics
item.description: A tuple is a Python data structure used to store data that shouldn't be modified later.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Zip Function
item.description: Python's zip function takes two related sequences and joins them together on their indexes into one data structure.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Dictionary Methods
item.description: Dictionary methods to retrive keys, values and loop over key value pairs
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: String Methods
item.description: Python string methods to capitalize all values, lowercase all values, split by a separator and more.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Strings Basics
item.description: Covers what's a string, how to access values in a string, get the length, traverse a string and more.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman
